review_title: Very Old-School, Only Care About Money
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Seneca Falls, NY
pros: Decent pay and good benefits package with nice 403b match after 1 year, 35-hour workweeks from 8:30-4:30, lovely community and area, free chiropractic care from students as an employee, and they are science evidence-based so the school produces very good chiropractors.
cons: The management and overall attitude of the administration is very dated, with no fresh perspectives or innovations in barely any department. Very stick-to-the-status-quo type of management, and long-time employees dislike when new ideas come to the table to improve the college and experience for students. Enrollment is down, pay was cut because of COVID and while I was there, there was never a mention of pay going back to normal or even raises. No job opportunities for growth as administrative staff. The school's marketing hasn't gotten with the times and still preforms like its the 2000s, even with the new college name. Enrollment has been down overall so outlook is bleak without new, fresh, much needed improvements to draw in students and keep the ones that are there from hating the place so much. Instead of investing in worth-while initiatives (or even marketing efforts) to draw students in and actually improve the college, they fundraised money for a courtyard-style clock... and that says what it needs to about where this school's priorities are. Administration cares enough about the school to keep it funded and running, but not enough to improve it.

review_title: One of Best Colleges to Work for-- LITERALLY!
pros:
there's a reason why NYCC has been on the list for "The Best Colleges to Work For" for several years in a row!  
Administration is very supportive, Finger Lakes WINE COUNTRY!!!,dirt cheap low living costs, campus is large, facilities, great retirement benefits, great health benefits (free acupuncture & chiropractic care for you & your immediate family!)
cons:
the DC clinic system needs to figure out ways for the student not to sit in the "dungeon" unproductively when they should be busting their behinds to get some clinic experience. 
Some of the AOM faculty need to be more professional in dealing with other people.

job_title: Associate Professor, Clinical Science in Seneca Falls, NY
pros: I have worked many different jobs in many different careers over the span of my working adult life. At no time have I ever work with a greater group of committed individuals in such a professional atmosphere. We as a group are committed to producing the world's finest chiropractors, and we are given the support and encouragement to be able to bring out the best in each one of us, especially for myself.
cons: Compared to other types of teaching environments such as traditional colleges and universities, our program runs year round. Also we don't enjoy the benefits of tenure, but I personally believe that's likely a very good thing.

job_title: Health Office Assistant in Seneca Falls, NY
pros: The atmosphere is great to work in. Well rounded people from faculty to staff.
cons: The pay is okay for a single person. But for a family this is not the ideal job.

review_title: Students are Great, Culture needs work
job_title: Full Time Faculty in Seneca Falls, NY
cons: Culture needs help to avoid discrimination based on Gender or Race
